summary: The Fusion Advanced Manufacturing Parity Act (HR 5441) amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to incentivize the production of fusion energy components. It introduces a 25% production credit for these components and outlines a phase-out schedule starting in 2032. The bill defines "fusion energy component" extensively, including high-temperature superconducting magnets, fusion chambers, and various related items. It also makes conforming amendments and sets an effective date of December 31, 2025.
